@RogerSchweikert I give them a lot of credit for what they’ve done to this point but between Apple, Amazon & Google I have a hard time seeing their longer-term path to success. If we assume the hardware eventually disappears I don’t know why their OS is anything special.

Their incentives are essentially based on not protecting your data (you can argue to what degree) & that's fine; they aren't twisting anyone's arm to use their platforms. Just understand what the business is based on...it ain't about protecting your data. It's about using it. $FB

In a word, yes. But social is not as resilient as something like search for example so I don't think the road forward is as clear for $FB as perhaps it once was. I think they're sandbagging guidance personally but that's just a hunch.

@errolnyc Good on them for testing but it’s all still based on ads & their primary purpose is still social. Could make for some incremental revenue but don’t discount the hard work that Amazon has put in. When it comes to selling stuff their data is far superior as it’s based on reality.

Difficult to see $FB ever gaining meaningful hold in commerce. There’s such thing as quality of data; $AMZN is based on actual shopping behavior, they’ve been collecting it for years. Ads are ads & it’s a coin flip as to whether what people post in FB & IG even reflects reality.
